title: Treating Plant Contact Dermatitis
brief: Remove plant oils and treat skin reactions from poisonous plant contact.
steps: Step 1: Immediately wash affected skin with soap and cold water to remove plant oils.
Step 2: If water unavailable, repeatedly wipe skin with dirt or sand to absorb oils.
Step 3: Stop using dirt if blisters have formed to prevent infection.
Step 4: After oil removal, thoroughly dry the affected area.
Step 5: Apply tannic acid solution made from oak bark if available.
Step 6: Crush and rub jewelweed on the rash if found in the area.
warnings: Never burn poisonous plants - smoke can be as harmful as direct contact.
Contaminated equipment can spread the poison - clean all gear.
Risk increases when overheated and sweating.
Do not break open blisters as this opens wounds to infection.
